meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unsociable.
meanings.sent1: Her unsociabilities made it difficult for her to make friends.
meanings.sent2: His unsociabilities often led to him feeling lonely at social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unsociabilities, he still managed to enjoy his own company.
meanings.sent4: The unsociabilities of the old house gave it a mysterious and eerie aura.
meanings.sent5: The unsociabilities of the cat made it clear that it preferred solitude.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of being unfriendly or uncommunicative in social situations.
meanings.sent1: She displayed her unsociabilities by avoiding eye contact and staying silent.
meanings.sent2: His unsociabilities made it hard for others to approach him at parties.
meanings.sent3: His unsociabilities at the party were so extreme that people thought he was a statue.
meanings.sent4: The unsociabilities of the storm clouds kept everyone indoors.
meanings.sent5: The unsociabilities of the grumpy neighbor were legendary in the neighborhood.
